channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13006] Document visibility label support for groups
item.description: This is to document the changes added from HBASE-12745.
item.summary: Document visibility label support for groups

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attached a patch that updates the Security chapter of the Book.
Built the book, opened in a browser, and verified the appearance and format to be good.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12701221/HBASE-13006.patch
against master branch at commit 49b4f3737eb0dd7c5d88d6dcbe8b5d4f167c6a2b.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12701221

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified tests.
+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+VisibilityClient API and shell commands can be used to set, get and clear visibility labels for users and groups. Groups are prefixed with an @ symbol.
+When checking visibility labels of a user, the server will include the labels of the groups of which the user is a member, together with the user's own labels.
+`get_auths` shell command or corresponding API on a user will only return the user's own labels. `clear_auths` shell command or corresponding API on a user will only clear the user's own labels.

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/12987//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.

Attached v2.
Added group usage example in the shell ruby scripts too.

Hi, Misty Stanley-Jones, Anoop Sam John

Can you help get this in?
Tested it by building the doc and running the shell command. Format looks good.

Looks good to me.

When the labels are retrieved using API/Shell command for a user, we will return labels added specifically for that user alone but not the group level labels granted for him/her. Some where in the doc we can mention this point also Jerry He?

LGTM.

Attached v3 that addressed Anoop's comment.

I had it in the first version, but was trying to simplify it in v2
Now added that statement back in. It is better to have it.
Thanks.

Tested by building the docs and displaying it in browser.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12704720/HBASE-13006-v3.patch
against master branch at commit 0505b7941e175d86004daf9a31ef5ce240d4570f.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12704720

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+Groups can be granted visibility labels the same way as users. Groups are prefixed with an @ symbol. When checking visibility labels of a user, the server will include the visibility labels of the groups of which the user is a member, together with the user's own labels.
+When the visibility labels are retrieved using API `VisibilityClient#getAuths` or Shell command `get_auths` for a user, we will return labels added specifically for that user alone, not the group level labels.

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Patch LGTM. ramkrishna.s.vasudevan or Anoop Sam John, you tried it? If so, commit?

Hi, guys

All has been tested in the parent HBASE-12745. Also we have a test case TestVisibilityLablesWithGroups to prevent regression.
For peace of mind, I did some testing again today. Works well.

As 'hbase' (super user):


a) create 'table1'



b) added 3 rows.

hbase(main):006:0> scan 'table1'

ROW                             COLUMN+CELL

 r1                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542420443, value=value1

 r2                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542431203, value=value2

 r3                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542439977, value=value3

3 row(s) in 0.0330 seconds



c) add label 'private'

hbase(main):011:0> add_labels 'private'

0 row(s) in 0.3930 seconds



d) set label on r1 only 

hbase(main):013:0> set_visibility 'table1', 'private', {FILTER => "(PrefixFilter ('r1'))"}

1 row(s) in 0.0450 seconds

As 'user1':


hbase(main):003:0> scan 'table1'

ROW                             COLUMN+CELL

 r2                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542431203, value=value2

 r3                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542439977, value=value3

2 row(s) in 0.0240 seconds

No r1, as expected.

As 'hbase':


hbase(main):014:0> set_auths '@users', 'private'

0 row(s) in 0.0480 seconds



hbase(main):015:0> get_auths '@users'

private

0 row(s) in 0.0450 seconds

As 'user1':


hbase(main):001:0> scan 'table1'

ROW                             COLUMN+CELL

 r1                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542420443, value=value1

 r2                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542431203, value=value2

 r3                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542439977, value=value3

3 row(s) in 0.3670 seconds

As 'hbase':


hbase(main):016:0> clear_auths '@users', 'private'

0 row(s) in 0.0370 seconds

As 'user1':


hbase(main):002:0> scan 'table1'

ROW                             COLUMN+CELL

 r2                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542431203, value=value2

 r3                             column=family:c1, timestamp=1426542439977, value=value3

2 row(s) in 0.0220 seconds

r1 is not showing up, as expected.

Attached a patch that updates the shell commands only, with no doc update.
Since we only commit doc update to master/2.0. This patch is for the other versions.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12705379/shell-update-only.patch
against master branch at commit f9a17edc252a88c5a1a2c7764e3f9f65623e0ced.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12705379

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.
